question: Which of the followingis not likely a biological, cultural, or genetic outcomewhen populations increasingly interact with other populations through trade and migration?

answers.text: Increased chance for the transference of genetic material, which can affect health outcomes of merging populations
A decreased chance for the transference of genetic material
An increased need for adaptation to a new culture along with an increased risk of facing oppression or even slavery if migrating populations are viewed as a minority in the new population
A greater chance for certain diseases or lack of immunity to pathogens to which a population was not exposed
